TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Html extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: This class processes HTML strings into displayable styled text.

remarks.para: This class processes HTML strings into displayable styled text. Not all HTML tags are supported.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Text.ISpanned FromHtml(string source) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns displayable styled text from the provided HTML string with the legacy flags #FROM_HTML_MODE_LEGACY.

remarks.para: Returns displayable styled text from the provided HTML string with the legacy flags #FROM_HTML_MODE_LEGACY.
This member is deprecated. use #fromHtml(String, int) instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Text.ISpanned? FromHtml (string? source, Android.Text.FromHtmlOptions flags);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Text.ISpanned FromHtml(string source, valuetype Android.Text.FromHtmlOptions flags) cil managed
static member FromHtml : string * Android.Text.FromHtmlOptions -> Android.Text.ISpanned

Docs.summary: Returns displayable styled text from the provided HTML string.

remarks.para: Returns displayable styled text from the provided HTML string. Any <img> tags in the HTML will display as a generic replacement image which your program can then go through and replace with real images.
This uses TagSoup to handle real HTML, including all of the brokenness found in the wild.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Flags for #fromHtml(String, int, ImageGetter, TagHandler): Separate block-level elements with line breaks (single newline character) in between.

remarks.para: Flags for #fromHtml(String, int, ImageGetter, TagHandler): Separate block-level elements with line breaks (single newline character) in between. This inverts the Spanned to HTML string conversion done with the option #TO_HTML_PARAGRAPH_LINES_INDIVIDUAL.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Flags for #fromHtml(String, int, ImageGetter, TagHandler): Separate block-level elements with blank lines (two newline characters) in between.

remarks.para: Flags for #fromHtml(String, int, ImageGetter, TagHandler): Separate block-level elements with blank lines (two newline characters) in between. This is the legacy behavior prior to N.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string? ToHtml (Android.Text.ISpanned? text, Android.Text.ToHtmlOptions option);
.method public static hidebysig string ToHtml(class Android.Text.ISpanned text, valuetype Android.Text.ToHtmlOptions option) cil managed
static member ToHtml : Android.Text.ISpanned * Android.Text.ToHtmlOptions -> string

Docs.summary: Returns an HTML representation of the provided Spanned text.
Docs.returns: string containing input converted to HTML

remarks.para: Returns an HTML representation of the provided Spanned text. A best effort is made to add HTML tags corresponding to spans. Also note that HTML metacharacters (such as "<" and "&") within the input text are escaped.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Text.ToHtmlOptions enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: Option for #toHtml(Spanned, int): Wrap consecutive lines of text delimited by '\n' inside <p> elements.

remarks.para: Option for #toHtml(Spanned, int): Wrap consecutive lines of text delimited by '\n' inside <p> elements. BulletSpans are ignored.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Text.ToHtmlOptions ToHtmlParagraphLinesIndividual = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Text.ToHtmlOptions enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Text.ToHtmlOptions enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: Option for #toHtml(Spanned, int): Wrap each line of text delimited by '\n' inside a <p> or a <li> element.

remarks.para: Option for #toHtml(Spanned, int): Wrap each line of text delimited by '\n' inside a <p> or a <li> element. This allows ParagraphStyles attached to be encoded as CSS styles within the corresponding <p> or <li> element.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
